Articles.Content:
Great! Made a small Patreon pledge for all your labors.

Besides, is it bad to have both ETT and CTT in my GameData? <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> forcibly installs CTT together with Interstellar Extended, which in turn is in ETT's suggested mods. It sounds like a trouble, especially for new players who will simply follow your suggestions and encounter a tech trees conflict. I deleted the CTT folder manually and hope it won't break anything.

PS: <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> still lists ETT's max KSP version as 1.1.3.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-25T07:44:47Z" title="10/25/2016 07:44  AM" data-short="7 yr">October 25, 2016</time> by garwel**

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, garwel said:
> 
> 
> Great! Made a small Patreon pledge for all your labors.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Besides, is it bad to have both ETT and CTT in my GameData? <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> forcibly installs CTT together with Interstellar Extended, which in turn is in ETT's suggested mods. It sounds like a trouble, especially for new players who will simply follow your suggestions and encounter a tech trees conflict. I deleted the CTT folder manually and hope it won't break anything.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> PS: <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> still lists ETT's max KSP version as 1.1.3.
> 

Thank you garwel.  I really appreciate it.

When CTT is installed alongside of ETT, ETT will take precedence.  The only problem that occurs (besides a <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> conflict) is when trying to use a save game that was using CTT (or the stock tech tree) and then installing ETT.  Both tech trees are then displayed over each other.

Maybe this version of ETT will update <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>'s listing to 1.2.

Any idea why [<abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr> items are tripled](http://imgur.com/a/wn0Ws) in the Start node? Is it ETT or is it <abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr> itself? I'm using the dev version of the latter.

Besides, don't you think Communotron 16 is not needed at the Start? Probe cores all have built-in 5 km antennas, which should suffice for the first few missions.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-25T18:09:17Z" title="10/25/2016 06:09  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 25, 2016</time> by garwel**

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, garwel said:
> 
> 
> Probe cores all have built-in 5 km antennas
> 

Built-in antennas can only receive commands and cannot transmit science data back

> 
> 
> 38 minutes ago, Eklykti said:
> 
> 
> Built-in antennas can only receive commands and cannot transmit science data back
> 

But you have a parachute in the beginning, so you can recover science.

Thanks for your ETT, Probus. Really wonderful.

But I cannot designate anyone to the EAS-1 command seat from the very beginning! Is that of the ETT( or other mods I have installed )? And what's wrong with it?..

[@OME](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/170800-ome/) You need [Take Command](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/108711-112-take-command-launch-kerbals-in-external-command-seats-v141-may-6-2016/) for that. But it hasn't been updated for 1.2 yet, it seems.

> 
> 
> 20 minutes ago, garwel said:
> 
> 
> [@OME](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/170800-ome/) You need [Take Command](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/108711-112-take-command-launch-kerbals-in-external-command-seats-v141-may-6-2016/) for that. But it hasn't been updated for 1.2 yet, it seems.
> 

Thanks for reply. So that means it just a kinda ornament for now? ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

And BTW, I wonder how to adjust my rocket's direction without <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> and manned pod at the start of the ETT tech tree? I try to use minimal solid fuel engine to do that....But did our predecessor use the same method?
There's just no such way, as far as I know. You need to discover a reaction wheel or, better, a <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr>-enabled probe core to do that.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, OME said:
> 
> 
> And BTW, I wonder how to adjust my rocket's direction without <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> and manned pod at the start of the ETT tech tree? I try to use minimal solid fuel engine to do that....But did our predecessor use the same method?
> 

I usually play aimed to get my first <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr>-enabled probe core and as much science as I can get.  Then work the tree depending on my goals for the campaign game.

> 
> 
> On 10/25/2016 at 0:48 PM, garwel said:
> 
> 
> Any idea why [<abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr> items are tripled](http://imgur.com/a/wn0Ws) in the Start node? Is it ETT or is it <abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr> itself? I'm using the dev version of the latter.
> 

I'm not sure.  I will have to check and see.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Probus said:
> 
> 
> I'm not sure.  I will have to check and see.
> 

Nevermind, it looks like I had two copies of <abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr> in my GameData. Not sure why there were three, but it's not an ETT bug.

Would love to see [CactEye](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/79924-cacteye-orbital-telescope/) and [RoverScience Revisited](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/67979-113-roverscience-revisted-212-better-interactive-science-for-rovers/) supported by ETT...

EDIT: Interstellar's new power beaming parts are also available way too early, IMO.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-30T10:21:30Z" title="10/30/2016 10:21  AM" data-short="7 yr">October 30, 2016</time> by garwel**

I would like to give a suggestion in changing some parts in the tree.

<u>Part:</u> Universal Storage: Atmospheric Sensor  
<u>Reason:</u> the Atm. Sensor is in the invention node, so its U.S. part probably should be there too.

<u>Part:</u> Universal Storage: Science Bay  
<u>Reason:</u> Together with the first U.S. adapter (QuadCore)

<u>Part:</u> Universal Storage: <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> Container  
<u>Reason:</u> Together with the first U.S. adapter (QuadCore) and first <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> Container

**FROM**  

dmUSAtmosSense @ generalConstruction  

US\_1M110\_Wedge\_ScienceBay @ simpleCommandModules  

US\_1R110\_Wedge\_KISContainer @ advConstruction

**TO**  

dmUSAtmosSense @ scienceTech  

US\_1M110\_Wedge\_ScienceBay @ generalConstruction  

US\_1R110\_Wedge\_KISContainer @ generalConstruction

How will this affect contract gameplay? The idea is interesting but given that the tech tree is much more complex, I'm concerned you might get advanced contracts that require parts/engines that now take much more time to unlock.  

Is this based off Community Tech Tree? If not, is it more complete?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-30T14:09:09Z" title="10/30/2016 02:09  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 30, 2016</time> by 1990eam**

*Delete double post.*

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-30T14:12:24Z" title="10/30/2016 02:12  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 30, 2016</time> by 1990eam**

> 
> 
> On ‎10‎/‎29‎/‎2016 at 1:36 PM, garwel said:
> 
> 
> Would love to see [CactEye](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/79924-cacteye-orbital-telescope/) and [RoverScience Revisited](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/67979-113-roverscience-revisted-212-better-interactive-science-for-rovers/) supported by ETT...
> 
> 
> 
> 
> EDIT: Interstellar's new power beaming parts are also available way too early, IMO.
> 

Will do and I will check the power beaming part placement.  Are these the Interstellar power beaming parts because I left them pretty much the way [@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/) wanted them.

> 
> 
> 21 hours ago, 1990eam said:
> 
> 
> How will this affect contract gameplay? The idea is interesting but given that the tech tree is much more complex, I'm concerned you might get advanced contracts that require parts/engines that now take much more time to unlock.  
>   
> 
> Is this based off Community Tech Tree? If not, is it more complete?
> 

I have spent 100's of hours tweaking this tree for contract gameplay [@1990eam](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/170552-1990eam/)  The hard part is if you split a 45 point node in the stock tree for instance, the 2 nodes you make have to add up to a little more than 45 points or things will get way out of balance really quickly.  That being said, I think the stock tree is way to easy to complete as you don't really even have to leave Kerbin's <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr>, just hit the Mun and Minmus biomes.

It is not based on CTT, but I have added all of [@Nertea](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/83952-nertea/)'s nodes plus many more of my own.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-31T11:50:46Z" title="10/31/2016 11:50  AM" data-short="7 yr">October 31, 2016</time> by Probus**

> 
> 
> 16 hours ago, Probus said:
> 
> 
> Will do and I will check the power beaming part placement.  Are these the Interstellar power beaming parts because I left them pretty much the way [@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/) wanted them.
> 

The power beaming parts (there are half a dozen of these, I think) are unlocked at Advanced Electrics, which costs only 15 science points and only requires Electronics to become available. I think this is way too early as power beaming is obviously a very advanced, late-game technology.

On another note, I think the placement of many <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS parts (specifically, 3 sizes of Fertilizer Tanks, 4 Nom-O-Matics + their legacy counterparts, RT-500 & RT-5000 Recycling Modules, Observation Cupola, and Viewing Cupola) in Survivability is also incorrect. First, because they are available waaay too early (actually only requiring 5 science points to unlock) compared to all other manned spaceflight technologies. Second, because the Survivability branch mostly deals with chutes and not with recycling and recreation. I suggest putting them into Long-Term Habitation and/or Space Stations sections. Not sure about specific nodes as I haven't reached those yet (and I play with Fog of Tech).

Released a new update for the Engineering Tech Tree.  See download links on first page.  Here is the changelog:

Added or Updated Cacteye, Rover Science, Coatl Aerospace ProbesPlus, Near Future Construction, Near Future Spacecraft, Extra-Planetary Launchpads, SpaceY, Infernal Robotics, Rocket Factory, <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support, <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Exploration Pack, <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Survivability Pack, <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Sounding Rockets, <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Core, Kerbal Atomics, Dark Side Technology, Real Chutes

Also tried to implement many of your suggestions.  Thank you for your help.  I still have a lot of work to do but I will update ETT regularly.

FYI, I have not updated github yet.

Is the Unplaced node supposed to be visible? I see the node after starting a new game, no other mods installed.

![nhJFpaf.png](http://i.imgur.com/nhJFpaf.png)

> 
> 
> 23 hours ago, ev0 said:
> 
> 
> Is the Unplaced node supposed to be visible? I see the node after starting a new game, no other mods installed.
> 

It really shouldn't be.  I use it for maintenance of the mod.  I will take care of it in the next release.  Thanks!

I have also created a life support branch off of the manned nodes.  This will be ready also.

I also get a null reference for the specialized\_control icon.

Let me preface this by saying that I am a huge fan of this mod and am in no way complaining passive-aggressively as it may come off as, but...

How do I fix this/what am I doing wrong with this:

![YGmNVtL.png](http://i.imgur.com/YGmNVtL.png)

I have used this mod in other versions but this is my first attempt with it in 1.2.1.  I would love any help.  Thanks a ton. 

Edit:  I am using Hide Empty Tech Nodes addon, but when I'm not, there ARE empty nodes which I never encountered before.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-24T20:08:50Z" title="11/24/2016 08:08  PM" data-short="7 yr">November 24, 2016</time> by ev0**

[@ev0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/116691-ev0/) ([@Probus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/102512-probus/)) I had v0.5 installed.  Grabbing v0.6 seemed to fix the error.  Thanks fort he help!
